title: Not Just Films, Karni Sena Now Has Problem With Bigg Boss & Internet Is Having Fun Like Always!
text:
Not Just Films, Karni Sena Now Has Problem With Bigg Boss & Internet Is Having Fun Like Always!

Not Just Films, Karni Sena Now Has Problem With Bigg Boss & Internet Is Having Fun Like Always!

It has been a long time since you saw Rajput Karni Sena in news, the community that gained national fame because of their unreasonable objections against Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Padmaavati, the movie which was later named Padmaavat?

BCCL

On and off, they have been making headlines since then. From movies like Manikarnika to Article 15, they have had objections and threats for several people from the film fraternity.

BCCL

And as if the movies weren’t enough, now the Rajput community is objecting to TV shows as well. The one that has recently come under their scanner is the most controversial reality TV show, hosted by Salman Khan – Bigg Boss 13.

BCCL

Don't Miss 617 SHARES 753 SHARES 103 SHARES 1.9 K SHARES 14.9 K SHARES

According to reports, Karni Sena thinks that the show is against Indian culture as it makes men and women share the same bed. It is promoting Love Jihad, it said in a letter to Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javdekar where they are seeking a ban on the show.

Twitter

They think the show shall be banned under Hindu Act for it made a Kashmiri Muslim man Asim Riaz share bed with Hindu girl Mahira Sharma. Also to note here is a fact that in the last episode of the show, Bigg Boss asked the contestants to chose their Bed partners on their own. So, now it is contestants’ choice as to who they want to share bed with.

Meanwhile, the internet is having a field day trolling Karni Sena yet again.

Not only Karni Sena, a BJP MLA from Ghaziabad, Nand Kishore Gujjar also has a problem with the show. According to a report on TOI, he has also written a letter to I&B ministry. "Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on one hand, is trying to make India regain its lost glory and, on the other, such shows were demeaning the country's culture," he wrote in the letter demanding a ban.

Also, the Confederation of All India Traders had also written to I&B Ministry seeking a ban on the show.
